text: Very impressive baltic porter. Sweet aroma with dark malts and caramel. Full body, dark roasted malts, some marcipan maybe.
En nariz espectacular: chocolate, con algo de vainilla, alcohol y humo. Muy compleja. En boca pierde un bastante entra muy dulce y es demasiado alcohólica. para mi gusto. Batch 374 BB 20/01/2019

Bottle. Dark brown pour with a chocolate head. Chocolate and caramel bouquet. Dark roasted malts give way to chocolate, caramel, and dark fruit highlights. A bit astringent like theres some coffee somewhere in the mix. After reading the description, I totally get the Demerara sugar influence. Good body and mouthfeel. Actually, I impressed. A very good Baltic Porter.

330 mL bottle. Black with a hint of transparency. Smells of dark fruits, heavy roasted malt, booze, and some dark chocolate. Tastes very sweet, but with a heavy dose of roasted malts that cut the sugars. Boozy and tingly. Dark fruity sweetness. Bitter dark chocolate finish. Heavy. Probably couldnt drink a ton of this, but its tasty.
Barwa ciemnobrązowa, niska piana. Intensywny aromat, kawa, czekolada. W smaku dochodzi szlachetny alkohol. Sporo ciała.
Really black color with nice head. Aroma is coffee, roasted. Flavor is roasted malt, too boozy.

Dark brown pour with small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, fudge, lactose, slight coffee. Taste follows the aroma. Full bodied, medium carbonation, perfectly balanced. An amazing beer that really surprised and blew me away, Great job! Everything I love about this beer style was perfected in this brew, BRAVO!

Piana beżowa, niezbyt wysoka. Zapach intensywny. Mocny sos sojowy. Czekolada, lekka kawa. W smaku pełne, czekolada, lekko mleczna. Trochę wanilii, kawy. Dużo ciemnych słodów. Alkohol zupełnie ukryty.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with moderate dark tan head that settles quickly. Aromas of sweet molasses, soy sauce, oily black coffee, and wet roasted malts. Flavours follow same with additional powdery dark chocolate and rich nuttiness. Porter or stout, I dont know. But great stuff.

12oz bottle pour into a chalice. I sat on this as long as I could; I wonder if I "calmed my pants" long enough on it, as was requested by the fellow at the local bottle shop? Rich chocolate, oaky roasted malts, maybe a bit of maple? Sweet, rich, and boozy. Velvety goodness. What a monster. Perhaps this was wasted on a gorgeous mid-May evening? Will find more. They better have more. They must.

[8872-20161110] 330mL bottle. Chocolate cocoa and coffee aroma. Black body with a medium-lasting foamy brown head. Bitter chocolate light coffee roasted grains flavour. Medium body. Delicious. (8/3/8/4/15) 3.8+
(c/o Timo, w/ blankboy, jercraigs)

Masa czekolady,kawy oraz kakao z równie solidnymi atakami czekoladowych pralinek,do tego słodkie ciemne owoce wymoczone w równie słodkim alkoholu,a do tego wszystkiego solidne palone oraz popiołowe długie akcenty,lekka cierpkość od mocno dojrzałej czereśni,delikatny niuans dębu,oraz ziemisty,czarny jak smoła profil całości. Piękna i arcy smaczna sprawa i jednocześnie obowiązkowa pozycja w podróży przez świat piwnego kraftu! 
Co prawda ten minimalny,lekko zbyt natarczywy z początku alkohol śmiało powinien się za jakiś rok czy dwa ułożyć przez co całość wypadnie zdecydowanie lepiej,lecz póki co w wersji tak zwanej"świeżej" wypadło genialnie i arcy smacznie!

Tap (Beer Geek Madness North Side). Piana niska, beżowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, koronkowanie słabe. Barwa czarna. W aromacie orzechy, czekolada, karmel. Goryczka średnia. W smaku czekolada, kawa, nuty kwaśne od ciemnych słodów. Pełnia średnia, nasycenie średnie.

Drobniuteńka piana, prawie jak na azocie. Aromat bardzo złożony, dużo czekolady, kakao, nieco suszonych owoców w tle szlachetny alkohol. Bardzo gładkie, czekoladowe, pół wytrawne, na końcu rozgrzewający alkohol. Ociera się wręcz o risa a niektóre bije na głowę. Czy to jeszcze porter bałtycki ? Ciężko mi stwierdzić ale nad pewno jest to świetne piwo. Wersja leżakowana w beczkach musi urywać dupę.

Aroma has plum, raisin, cognac, syrup, dried plum, dried apricot and gasoline. Taste is slightly oily, more than dry. Its well balanced. Taste has roasted malt,dried plum, chocolate, licorice, burnt coffee. Complex baltic porter.

Had the beer at the Kompaan Bloedbroeder Festival 2016. The beer looks amazing. Its just the way it should look like. The beer is pitch black on the naked eye. In the light a nice ruby red color is unveiled. On top of the beer a nice soft creamy layer of brown foam is formed. It looks so soft. Delicious.
The smell is delicious. There is a lovely rich aroma of coffee, caramel, chocolate, liquorice and roasted barley. There are both bitter and sweet aromas, in very good balance. There is a lovely warming alcohol aroma. I also smell some vanilla. The smell is very rich. All aromas are clearly present and blend together really really well. It has everything a baltic porter should have: so gentle yet so rich and delicious. I love it.
The taste is also amazing. It is so well balanced. One of the best beers till now. I taste lovely aromas of coffee, chocolate, some red fruits and roasted barley. Sweets and bitters are in perfect balance. It is delicious. Estonian beers, especially from Põhjala, always amazed me, but this is next level. I might even call this the best beer Ive ever had. I want more of this. 
The palate of the beer is also lovely. Minuscule gentle gas bubbles enrich the aromas and flavours perfectly. Amazing beer, it leaves me speechless now...

Bottle at Hilton Park Tallinn
Pours deep black with virtually no head. Thick oily texture that sticks to the glass. Aroma of salty licorice, roasted malts and coffee. Roasted malts and alcohol dominate the taste. Salty licorice, rye pudding, nuts and dry hoppiness provide a nice background. Full bodied, very pleasent oily palate, although alcohol pushes through a little too much. Definitely a decent, albeit not spectacular, strong imperial porter.
Tap @ Beer Geek Madness 5. (Backlog). Pitch black, small foam. Fruits, plum, cherry, blackcurrant, roasty. Medium sourness, small sweetness. Full body, fizzy.
UPDATED: MAY 20, 2017 Its a quite good baltic porter, however from the hype I was expecting better. Chocolate and coffee in the foreground with a hint of smokiness. However, could use more head.

W aromacie intensywna czekolada, wanilia, likier kawowy. W smaku podobnie, wyraźna czekolada, wanilia, kawa, lekkie nuty alkoholowe na dopuszczalnym poziomie, nie przeszkadzają, nie za słodko, lekka paloność, lekka goryczka kakaowo - kawowa. Kolor prawie czarny, pod światło ciemnobrunatny, piana niewielka, niezbyt trwała, redukuje się do otoczki. Dosyć lekkie w odbiorze, trochę za duże wysycenie, właściwie to jedyny minus. Rewelacyjne piwo.

Super pleasant, well balanced aroma. Full of chocolate, dark and red fruits, plums, cherry notes with a touch of alcohol. Taste is also awesome. Less fruity, much more roasted. Has even som coffee notes. Except that - chocolate, dark bread, raisins. Alcohol is a bit to harsh, this beer will only gain on maturing. Soft and silky mouthfeel. Really good beer, need some time to arrange and round the alcohol.

Jai rarement vu un tel pétrole... Coulée bitumineuse, opacité totale et mousse carrément brune. Pas beige hein. Brune. Marron quoi. Nez enchanteur et pas agressif du tout sur le cacao, le café, le caramel bien brûlé, le miel, le sirop dérable, la mélasse, la noix, le pruneau, la vanille, la pâte de noisette, des notes de fruits confis (fraise, cassis, mûre...), et lalcool. On devine aussi les levures avec ces arômes de sous-bois et de cuir. En bouche, texture ronde au démarrage et grosse sécheresse avec une astringence très puissante par la suite. Cest même assez surprenant davoir un palet aussi desséché sur une seule gorgée ! Lalcool est au niveau, il pousse bien comme il faut, la carbonatation est assez faible, comme toutes les Porter de la Baltique ceci étant dit, mais que dire de cette amertume absolument monumentale... Les saveurs de malt sont douces, bien rondes, la levure est nette sur les premières secondes mais les tanins des houblons viennent frapper là où ça fait mal. Larrière-bouche est sur le cacao très amer et le marc de café. La longueur est interminable avec limpression davoir bu un ristretto intense sans sucre et qui colle au dent. On est beaucoup plus proche dun Stout que dun Porter. Mais que cela nous importe, le plaisir est là. On a la combinaison dun Imperial Stout au maltage extrême avec lamertume dune Black IPA. Sur la suite de la dégustation, le palet se mithridatise (il fallait le glisser celui là !) et on apprécie dautant plus les saveurs des nombreux malts utilisés dans cette recette. Au final, cest un savoureux breuvage qui nous fait passer par de nombreux états comme un bon plat nous propose plusieurs textures et flaveurs. Il me tarde de déguster les autres variations de la brasserie autour de cette Öö. Pas la bière la plus impressionnante du monde, mais une excellente pioche de chez Pöhjala dont le style global me rappelle, plus localement, celui de la brasserie La Débauche. Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

Sample @ Beer Geek Madness 5. Lots of chocolate, sweetness and roasted notes. Marked bitterness, well perceptible alcohol. Quite good.

If any of these new generation craft breweries is to produce a top notch Baltic porter, it must be this one, situated in the heart of the Baltic region. Vintage bottle of about two years old, shared by Craftmember. Lightly lacing, creamy, pale beige, moussy head over a black beer with chestnut brown edges (showing its true colours only for about two millimeters off the edge). Lovely bouquet, a bit oxidized already but in the most flattering way imaginable, with impressions of very old dry madera, teriyaki, cappuccino in powder form, walnuts, bitter chocolate, tawny port wine, cassis, mocha ice cream, dried porcini, roasted saddle of hare, leather. Restrained candied sweetness (fig) in the onset with a dim background sourishness surrounded by much more outspoken, somewhat teriyaki-like umami flavours, softish carbo, thick oily mouthfeel, viscous; very nutty malt character, bitter chocolate in its core with lots of toasted bitterness all around, the bitterness accentuated in the end by spicy hop bitterness. Wodka-like warming alcohol pushes a beautiful old madera-like oxidation upwards through the nose and that is where the true nobility of this beer lies; never had it in younger condition, but in this somewhat aged form, it has turned into a very sophisticated example of its style, which - due to its (usually) lager nature, I suppose - remains still a bit underexposed in the modern craft beer revolution. Except for Poland, that is, and hopefully a lot more new breweries in the Baltic countries will follow the Polish example, or indeed this one.
Beer Geek Madness. Aromat bardzo przyjemny, przede wszystkim czekoladowy. W smaku również głównie czekolada, delikatny alkohol.

Pierwsze co to bucha tu deserowa czekolada. Intensywny zapach. Dalej jest słodko, coś jak cukier brązowy, paloność, orzechy. Jest też taka delikutaśna śliwka. Pachnie tak troszeczkę jak RIS. W smaku jest dużo paloności. Pod palonością ukrywa się deserowa czekolada, pralinki, wiśnie i delikatna śliweczka. Konkretna goryczka. Alkohol rozgrzewa od pierwszego łyka i troszeczkę gryzie w gardło. Gęste i oleiste, jak dwa poprzednie. Wysycenie niskie. Piana ma kolor kawy z mlekiem, a samo piwo jest czarne i brak prześwitów. Szybko znika i zostaje tylko pierścień na tafli.

Bottle. Opaque black color with tanned head. Aroma has coffee, roasted malt, dark fruits, oak, whiskey. Taste is malty sweet with long aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, oak, dark fruits, roasted malt, raisins, coffee. Not so sweet as Pime öö but quite sweet still.

Kolor bardzo ciemny, prawie czarny, beżowa piana. W aromacie czekolada, praliny, kokos, suszone owoce, likierowy alkohol. W smaku czekolada, przypalona skórka od chleba, kawa zbożowa, szlachetny alkohol, suszone owoce w tle. Ten alkohol jednak trochę przeszkadza, pozostawia jakiś taki dziwny posmak (trochę bimbrowy). Piwo mnie nie powaliło, do naszych bałtyków nie ma podjazdu, chociaż ogólnie nie jest złe.
Sporo czekolady i kawy w aromacie, do tego przypieczony pumpernikiel niestety alkohol. W smaku podobnie, ale potencjał do leżakowania ogromny.

AROMAT : Intensywny. Dominuje gorzka czekolada oraz kawa. W tle wyraźny nieułożony alkohol.
SMAK : Wytrawne. Kawowo-czekoladowe. Taki sam posmak. Spore nasycenie, lekko szczypie w podniebienie.

OGÓLNIE : Ogromny zawód. Nieułożony alkohol w aromacie potwornie mnie drażnił. W smaku było troszkę lepiej, ale również bez zachwytu. Wersja z czarną porzeczką była o wiele lepsza.
Отличны& портер, приятны& аромат, мощный вкус, много жженки во вкусе, легкая горчинк& приятно& послевк&

W smaku mocno czekoladowe, słodkie, trochę pralinowe, goryczka niska, paloności mało. Ciało ok. Nic nie urywa, ale jest przyjemne

Almost black colour with medium head. Medium intensive aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and some dried fruits. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and slightly sour with very long sweet chocolate aftertaste . Soft carbonation. Full body. Full of chocolate baltic porter. Thumb up.

Zwart kleurig bier met een koffie achtige schuimkraag.

Aroma: melk chocolade, koffie, geroosterde mout en wat rook.

Smaak: zoetje, drop, geroosterd, espresso, klein beetje chocolade.

Voor het alcohol gehalte een wat dun mondgevoel, maar dit komt waarschijnlijk door de lager gist. Medium koolzuur.

Paloność, kawa zbożowa, delikatny prażony słonecznik, słodki aromat. W smaku jeszcze trochę mlecznej czekolady, czy słodkiej kawy, powiedziałbym że lekko RIS-owo, tyle że dość wodniście, półsłodkie z paloną kontrą.

Aromat kawa zbożowa z mlekiem, słonecznik, wanilia, dosc slodko.

330ml Bottle - Black with a small head. Chocolate, vanilla and dried fruit in the aroma. Roasted and moderately sweet taste with vanilla, chocolate, coffee and raisins detected. Smooth and very easy to drink for the abv.

Pour with little to no foam that vanishes quickly. Color is pitch black. Bottle design is very nice. Aroma has plum, raisin, cognac, syrup, dried plum, dried apricot and gasoline. Palate is slightly oily, more than dry. Its not that well balanced. Taste has dried plum, hot chocolate, licorice, burnt coffee. Its an okay porter, but I find the score to be a bit overrated. Its good, but not that good for me.

W aromacie czuć gorzką czekoladę, paloność i niestety aldehyd octowy. W smaku likierowe, gorzka czekolada, bardzo palone, wytrawne, gorzkie, gęste, agresywne. Nisko wysycone. Prezentowało się nieźle. Dobry Porter.

Bottle at home. Pitch black colour, small brown head dissipates fast. Nose is intense chocolate, roasted malts, light booze in the background. Taste is low bitterness. Intense chocolate, nuts, roasted malts. Silk smooth mouthfeel, well hidden alcohol. Lovely porter.
Sample from a friend. One of the best beers i have tasted. Black in color. Really intense aroma and flavor, very creamy, some warm alchool. Very complex, roasted malt, chocolate.

Pours pitch black, topped with a thin, cream colored head. Mild roasty nose with just a bit of woody presence and a hint of coffee. Just a little berry notes later on and some more prominent figs. Very strong, malty with some vanilla sweetness to it and quite some alcohol presence, a bit warm. A slight touch of roastiness in the finish. Medium full body and silky. A bit too sweet for my liking.

Bottle at home. I waited a bit to taste this one. Was not dissapointed. The beer is everything you would expect and much more. It is thick and creamy. The alcohol is so warming. So intense, it could be food. Food for the soul. Exceptional brew.
Black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and caramel aroma. Roasted malty chocolate licorice flavor with hints of caramel. Has a roasted malty chocolate and caramel finish.

Aroma: chocolate, brown sugar, some smokiness, dark berries. Taste is sweet, with quite strong bitterness for a baltic porter and roasted notes which brings it dangerously close to an imperial stout. Very good, but not exactly in style.
Czarne, nieprzejrzyste z drobnopęcherzykową pianą. W aromacie i smaku czekolada, pralinki.

Kran. Bardzo konkretny porter bałtycki z wyraźną palonością, do tego w smaku i zapachu deserowa czekolada, kakao, ciemny chleb, przyjemne nuty utlenienia, nuty śliwkowe, wędzone, sos sojowy, dzieje się dużo. W wyglądzie czarne z bardzo solidną beżową pianą. Ogólnie bardzo dobry porter bałtycki o wyrazistym smaku i aromacie

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 In my opinion Pohjala kicks proud Polish porter brewers asses because this is everything what I expect from the style without any additions and I never recieved it in Polish beers.
Chocolate, vanilla and roasted malt (both taste and aroma). A lot of body, thick and slightly carbonated. Well balanced but with noticeable alcohol. Very good Baltic porter.

Tap @ Beer Temple, sample size. Black color. Dense light brown head with good retention. Aromas: sweet malts, caramel, light fruit, roasted. Light drop/licorice retronasal as well. Flavor is moderate sweet, droopy. Medium bodied. Finishes roasty, light bitter. Nice.

Butelka 330ml (14.04.2017). Piwo czarne, nieprzejrzyste z bardzo ładną, obfitą, bardzo drobną, jasno-brązową pianą. W aromacie intensywna nuta gorzkiej czekolady, zwłaszcza bezpośrednio po otworzeniu butelki. Po chwili dochodzi także lekko słodkawa nuta szlachetnego alkoholu, choć ten jest ukryty bardzo dobrze, praliny w czekoladzie a wszystko to bardzo przyjemne dla zmysłu powonienia. Słodkie, mega czekoladowe, pralinowe z ostrym palono-wytrawnym finiszem, wyraźnie rozgrzewające przełyk i od środka ale mimo to o bardzo gładkiej fakturze. Czekolada z nutką szlachetnego alkoholu w płynie, po prostu świetne.

Tak dominującego aldehydu octowego dawno nie czułem w żadnym piwie, jest tak wyrazisty, że przykrywa inne aromaty. Trzeba naprawdę dobrze się wwąchać by wyczuć nuty melasy, ciemnego pieczywa i kawy.
W smaku słodkie, z dominującą palonością. Melasa, przypalony karmel również sa obecne, ale raczej w tle. Finisz jest wytrawny, wyraźnie popiołowy z narzucającym się alkoholem, który rozgrzewa gardło.
Jet black with a small tan head. Big aroma of licorice, chocolate, booze and vanilla. Sweet roasted flavour with licorice and caramel. Notes of herbal hops and of ash. Big beer

Black, non-transparent with fine, beige head. Roast malts, dark chocolate, dark fruit, dried fruit, plum, raisin and molasses notes. Sweet with dark chocolate finish and aftertaste. Full-bodied with low carbonation.
33cl bottle. Pours black with small beige head. Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and liquorice. Light to medium sweetness, medium to heavy bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel. Really good.
Excellent big fella. All about the big chocolate flavour and aromas with dark fruits added in. Top class ja

Rich and solid body, sweet, pleasant roast with quite some sweetness - doesnt feel bottom fermented - sure this is not fermented with an Ale yeast? But a very rich and filling Stout without any flaws. 100117

Bottle - Cocoa and chocolate with some dark fruit. Jet black with a small brown head. Dark sweet roast and fruity notes. Nice.

Aroma: roast.

Bottle split at Hackobock Tasting, thanks to Dan Yull, 24/11/16.

text: Pours pitch black with a tan-coloured head which quickly dissipates to a ring. Coffee, chocolate, dark fruits and some alcohol in the aroma. The flavours are similar in the taste - theres plenty of dark chocolate, coffee, praline and roasted malts. The bitterness is moderate with a long roasted finish and warming from the alcohol. The body is medium to full, the carbonation is soft. A very nice baltic porter, nicely roasted, could be less boozy though.

Bottle. Pours black with a dark brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, Cocoa beans, coffee, caramel and vanilla. Taste of roasted malts, Coffee, savory notes, liquorice, dark chocolate and slight ashy notes.

Pitch black with a tiny mocha head that disappears instantly. Nose is coffee liquor, roasted malts, soy sauce, molasses. Taste is mild bitterish, smoked coffee with a subtle liquor/alcoholic base. Leaves a beautifully long, bitter, lightly smoked alcoholic aftertaste. Viscous, thick mouthfeel, light carbonation level. Amazing.
Not without the reason it is one of the best rated Baltic Porter. It is surely great, chocolate, roasted malts, bread, coffee notes. Medium to full body. Great one.

330ml bottle @ Matts. Pours a deep dark opaque brown. Nose is rye bread with a roasted character. Flavour is a very interesting yet balanced mix of molasses, roasted malts, bread, dark coffee, dark chocolate. Wow there is a lot of character that keeps building and changing.

330mL bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma brings out earthy, toasted malt, cocoa, and a touch of burnt sugar. Flavour is along the same lines, with dark burnt sugar, dark cocoa, and a little espresso. Finishes with burnt sugar. Wonderfully constructed. Excellent.

Very dark brown. This has a lot of tarry, rich burnt sugars to it on the nose and some dark fruits. The dark sugars really carry through, with burnt fruits, and a decent body. Got good sugars, touch of alcohol in the finish. Tasty, I like these characteristics in a beer.

Bottle, thanks to rosenbergh. Perfectly. Lack body with a thin light orange head. Light nose of raisins and peanuts. There is also a little bit of bread crust. The mouthfeel is a little sticky yet surprisingly light. Flavors of subdued milk chocolate and light raspberries are up front. As it warms you get a little bit of booze and roasted coffee. The finish is pleasantly sweet and long lasting with roast. A very well done big beer.
Roasted, caramel like, red fruits, oily texture, great start, a bit flat on the finish, with amazing potential.

Dark brown to black color with small dark brown head. Full body, average carbonation, no lacing. Smell of roast, rye, dark fruit, licorice, caramel, nougat, espresso, dark chocolate and vanilla. Similar aromas in taste with hints of tobacco smoke, roasted malts, resins, ash, molasses and toffee. Smooth and rich mouthfeel. Very aromatic and drinkable Baltic porter - though, its texture and flavors could give it a status of an imperial stout. Quite boozy also. But nevertheless, I have no cons for it. Very good beverage.

Bottle (10,5%). Very dark brow  almost black, small to average and mostly diminishing dark brown head. Moderate to full aroma, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light caramel with some roasted malt and light coffee and hoppyness. Body is medium to full, lightly sweetish, light caramel and roasted malt, faint coffee and alcohol. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, faint caramel and light roasted malt, light coffee and alcohol. Really nice roasty aroma. Flavor/finish is bit one-dimensional - could use more roastiness and/or bitterness to balance 10,5%

OK, this is my very 1000th beer. And my 58th Baltic Porter as per RB reckoning, although I do find that it is more, as many BPs have not been named as so, due to the somewhat negative perception of the style. BPs may not be my preferred beers, but certainly the most fascinating ones. The range of flavours, and the magic to transform dark lagers into masterpieces! I do love to think that I am the Southerner that has tasted and rated more Baltic Porters than any other, an undeniable regional style. New Zealand, guys  antipodean  I know it is not a competition, but I cannot get any close to numbers produced by the Scandinavian Mafia, the Baltic Triads or even the American Annihilators. And now I know someone else will point out that I am wrong. OK, back to Põhjala Öö, it was well chosen, I love the name. Yes, black as the night! Oily darkness, with a vibrant, dark russet head that has that lovely rainbow shine, making my eyes tear with expectation. Could be creamier, to be cold-blooded analysing, but I will still give it a five, for the pleasure it incites just by the look. Right, it is my 1000th, but I must confess that I have already done a lot of ratings that were unworthy of this position, so I will just post them later. This true Baltic Porter, by far the best Estonian one, is perhaps on the podium of world beers, with silver medal, and I found this bottle at Brolters, in Bremen. Thanks to Jinroh for pointing out the existence of this beauty. Right, perhaps I should mention some of the rating mates here, who have been really cool in exchanging stuff over these years, and of course I must give all praise to the missing Jono, I mean Jimthechap, who has been great company and an amazing friend. We are all concerned, and for his disappearance, but the hue & cry has already been raised. Search & rescue teams have trustworthy information that Jimthechap was last seen on an island to the north of New Zealand mainland, probably kidnapped by the publishing industry. We hope that he can survive this ordeal. And of course we have the great Traveller, ElDesmadre and Jinroh, all of whom I got to meet and share a pint or two. Tim, and Tsubasa, and Frank, and Ned, there have been so many others who have shared a drinking moment with me, or great correspondence, or who so kindly helped me with opportunities to taste some of the classic ones and so many novelties, and I just cannot have a fair and complete list of them here. Warm hugs to you all. I should also mention my landlord Spencer Kok, who is a pig and made my tasting session less pleasurable than it should have been. But back to this wonder of wonders, I absolutely love it. Aromas of tobacco leaves, smokey, vanilla, lakritz, leather, spiced schnapps, rum, and berries, perhaps the tart ones, and very dark ones, as somehow the aroma comes across to our eyes as being dark red. Lovely sweet taste of dark bitter chocolate, very dark and bitter, and a touch of roasted malts, bitter but sweet, with molasses, caramel, salt, liquorice, tart fruits and rum again, but never boozey, never pungent. This is all so incredibly well-crafted together, ultra-balanced. It is oily but round, silky even, absolutely easy to drink. A farking magnum opus. I am not sure of my other ratings for great beers, but I suspect this was the best non-Finnish true Baltic Porter. Or better: the best non-Sinebrychoff beer I have ever tasted. Gutted that I only had one bottle. Cannot wait to get back to Bremen for more.

Craft Beer Advent Calendar (Day 15) 330ml bottle pours black in color with a finger and a half of beige head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is chocolate and light roasted grains with some dark fruits. Taste is a dark fruity and chocolate malty sweetness with a light roasted grain and herbal hop bitterness. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, a well crafted brew that is a good representation of the style and recommended.

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Molasses, burnt sugars, dark malt, dark fruits, coffee and a hint of blackberry
Adjunct: Aroma is spiced rum, rye, toffee, coffee, and nuts; dark brown and oily looking with a 1 cm, light brown head; thick and oily and a little warm

[Bottle (330ml) shared with and c/o j&m] Pours a very dark amber-brown with an average size semi-lasting frothy light-brown head. Minimal lacing.Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, light vegetal notes, toffee and some alcohol. Flavour of roasted malt and coffee along with some toffee, light hops, dark fruit and alcohol. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel. Medium bodied. Pretty good.

Appearance: solid black with one finger of rocky beige head, good retention and minimal lacing. (3/5) Aroma: roasty malt, dark chocolate, jammy red berries, coffee, liquorice. (9/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, moderate-high bitter. (9/10) Palate: full slick body, low carbonation, sweet warming finish. (4/5)

Oh, hells yes, the Advent calendar is really moving in the right direction now! Day #15 is a Baltic Porter actually brewed on the shores of the Baltic, and it is fine. Its colour is what youd expect for a beer named Öö (night) but it tastes sweet and pleasantly boozy. Im reminded of the Turkish description of how coffee should be: black as hell, strong as death, sweet as love. Its not perfect - Id like to see better retention and lacing, the flavours arent completely integrated (though I suspect this would age beautifully), it finishes a bit sticky and mouth coating, and the alcohol carries a distinct sharp edge - but these are relatively minor considerations. (17/20)

Aroma is spicy, redcurrant, alcohol and dark chocolate. A bit harsh maybe. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is milk chocolate up front, coffee, red berry tang, finishes with dark chocolate, earthy and burnt chocolate brownies. Nice. (3.8)

Bottle at the Hackobock tasting, thanks to Dirty D. It pours darkest brown - black with a thick tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, creamy, fudge, Werthers original, creaminess, dried fruits and chocolate cake. The taste is bitter - sweet, rich roasted malt, liquorice, chocolate gateaux, warming alcohol, cherry bakewell, fruit compote and jam with a dry, cocoa finish. Full body and moderate carbonation. Rick, fruity and filthy. Nice one!

Bottle at home. Deep black, clear, minimal dark brown head, disappearing. Rich rosted malts, chocolate, wood, cream, biscuits, herbal like liquor (Jägermeister, Unicum). Woody taste, cocoa, licorice, liquor, herbal with balsamic notes, dry and rough.

33cl bottle shared at the Hackobock tasting, Craft Islington. Many thanks to daniel for this one. It pours a deep black color with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet and rich with notes of chocolate and pine cones. Taste is also sweet and roasty with notes of pine cones and caramel. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, OK
330 ml bottle. Pitch black, liquirice aroma, warm alcoholic taste rounded by malts and hops very well.

Bottle shared at the Craft beer Co tasting 24/11/2016. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. A dark mahogany brown coloured pour with a dark tan head. Aroma is earthy socks, brown sugars, hints of smoke, little apple. Flavour is composed of dark malts, liquorice, soy, dried fruits, earthy smoke, jammy fruits. Palate is medium sweet, moderate carbonation, oily, big. Good.

330 ml bottle. Pours a dark copper to black with a light red-brown head. The aroma is full of mildly roasted malt, caramel, cacao, hazelnuts. Medium to full body with a low carbonation, a medium to heavy sweetness and a very light bitterness. The taste is heavily malty with caramel, brown sugar and molasses up front followed by slightly more bitter aromas of light coffee and cacao.
Piligrim, Moscow bottle: pours black with a beige head. Aroma is rich chocolate, fresh coffee, molasses. Taste is sweet and chocolatey. Thick body. Lingering aftertaste. Pretty good.

Dark brown head sat on a jet black still body.
Strong dark chocolate aroma.
Smooth, oily, velvety & still on the palate. Very full bodied.
Dark chocolate, coffee, brown sugar, sweet black coffee, mocha & brandy flavours.
What a magnificent beer.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Daniel. Pours black-brown with a frothy, khaki head. The nose holds ripe dark fruits, light roast, burnt toast, nips of cocoa. Medium sweet flavour with some tangy berries, raisin, brown bread, light ash, charred sugars. Full bodied, lightly chewy, with fine carbonation. Warming finish with oily chocolate, more roast, baking cocoa, lightly tangy, ripe dark fruits, berries. Quite solid.
Reeeweeelacja! Mimo kataru aromaty cherry dały się wyczuć. Barwa czarna, piana obrączkuje i zostawia lekki lacing. W smaku wytrawne, wyraziste, wyQrwiste. Polecam!

Cocoa, caramel, coffee, roasted malts in aroma. Pours black with tan head. Taste is medium sweet with lots of chocolote, coffee, roastiness, ash and caramel. Medium bitter finish, full body, soft carbo. Overall good stuff.

2016-11-10. Black body with a moderate frothy brown head. 4+ Aroma of dark malt, dry dark malt. Flavour is quite bitter and moderately alcoholic up front. Dusty cocoa, dark malt. Average plus to medium bodied palate, good carbonation. Solid overall, but a bit rough at times. 7/4/7/4/15 Bottle courtesy of Timo from Finland.

Bottle from 100 Beers in Sofia. Heard great things about this one. So the question is: Is it good enough to make me say "Öö (oh-oh!)"? The beer is darkest brown with a half-finger tan head that fades to a ring. The aroma is nice, with mild roast, dark chocolate, anise, blackberry, stone fruits, and high-end vodka. The flavor is mildly sweet and well-balanced with a touch of bitterness. Quite complex, yet subtle, and very tasty. Medium-plus bodied and slick with low carbonation. Really good beer overall.
Bottle. Pitch black, small beige head. Roastiness, chocolate, small amount of caramel, some liqorice and fruits. All not very sweet with rather dry, roasty finish.

Mycket mörkt rödbrun med litet, mellanbrunt skum som lägger sig snabbt. Stor komplex doft med mörk choklad, kaffe, mörkt bröd, mörka körsbär och plommon. Fyllig smak med rejäl sötma från mörka frukter, men här finns också mörk choklad, lite kaffe och lakrits, och en fin avslutande beska som balanserar upp sötman. Stor rund munkänsla, man märker inget av den myckna alkoholen. En riktigt bra imperial stout som skulle passa bra till diverse chokladdesserter.
On tap. Black with nice brown head. Coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate and licorice in the aroma. Taste is sweet following the aroma. Overall, very good beer just a bit too sweet.

330ml bottle from 2016 craft beer advent calendar. Pours an opaque black with a small, creamy, short lived, brown head that leaves spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, caramel and licorice. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, licorice, caramel, vanilla, brown sugar and coffee with warming alcohol in a bitter finish. Full body with a smooth, creamy, oily texture and soft carbonation. Excellent has some complexity to it.

nice beer,
very dark black color,
smell of cofee, malt and caramel.
full body beer with few coffee and sweet notes.

Aroma: chocolate, prune, dried fruits, pumpernickel, toast
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, chocolate, earthy, alcohol, pumpernickel, roasty

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2017 Rerate. Shared bottle at Cardinal Mi2 05.06.17. Ebony. Brwn head. Fine aroma of dark malt, dark chocolate and berries. Similarly fine taste, with liquorice medium bitterness. Also a hint of wood. Long aftertaste.

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 24.10.16. Ebony. Pale brown head. Aroma of green apples, soap, roasted malt and some vanilla. Similar taste. [5/3/5/3/8=2,4]
Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours black with a small tanned head. Aroma is deep malty. Taste is smooth malty, with chocolate, weak tar and liquorice , very good and moreish.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2017 Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours black with light brown head. Aroma of dark bread, dark chocolate, alcohol. Tastes sweet with roasted bitterness. Alcoholic warmth, medium bodied. Re-rated 2017-06-05

(Draught at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam, 17 Sep 2016) Black colour with dense, brown head. Malty, roasted nose with sweet black espresso, dark chocolate, liquorice and hints of warm asphalt. Malty, roasted taste with notes of dark chocolate, milky coffee, liquorice and a balanced coffee bitterness in a sweetish, slightly vinous finish. Full body, quite sweet. Tasty and quite powerful. Very nice.

Volle bombastische smaak in je mond. Koffie(likeur), (pure) chocolade, tabak, leer, hout, drop. Tegen de stout aan. Hele lange, volle, warme koffie-bittere afdronk. Top top top.
[Notatki z WFP] Bardzo bogate aromaty, czekolada mleczna, kawa, karmel, nieco kokosa, lekkie suszone owoce. Zdradliwie pijalne.

Black, small brown head, nice lacing. Aroma: malt, caramel, cocoa, dark fruits. High to medium sweetness, full to medium body, medium bitterness. Nice smooth flavour: malty base, chocolate, bread, toast, dry fruits. Quite a lot of alcohol, dry bitter finish with roasted notes. Overall some potential but very alcoholic.

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, malt, roast, smoke, tar, dried fruits and sugar. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, malt, tar, smoke, roast, dried fruits and sugar. A nice beer!

Piwo z top 10 garunku i to widac. W smaku kawa, czekolada znakomicie skomponowane z goryczka qystepujaca po czasie. Piana drobna, dlugo utrzymujaca sie. Jak sam producent okresla piwo czarne jak estonska noc. Bardzo dobre

Kolor: bardzo ciemnobrunatny, klarowny.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, dość wolno opada.
Zapach: sporo aromatów ciemnych i palonych słodów, czekolady, kakao, trochę kawy, aromatów palonych, jest również karmel, ciemne owoce, delikatny alkohol.
Smak: wyraźna pełnia, przyjemna aksamitność, jak w aromacie sporo ciemnych słodów, kakao, czekolady, kawy, trochę słodowej słodyczy, ciemnych owoców, średnia goryczka, kawowa, lekko palona, wyraźny alkohol, trochę drażniący.
Wysycenie: średnie,

330 ml bottle, as Põhjala ÖÖ Imperial Baltic Porter. ABV is 10.5%. Pitch black colour, moderate brown head. The aroma has notes of roast malts, caramel, dark chocolate, molasses. Fairly sweet and rich flavour, with the same elements as in the aroma, also notes of liquorice, sweetened coffee and bittering hops. Pretty impressive.

Pianka drobna, brązowa, dość jednak szybko opada do firanki. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat intensywnie czekoladowy, truflowy, pralinowy, w tle nuty likierowe, espresso, jagodowe... W smaku analogicznie - szwajcarska droga czekolada i kakao na pierwszym planie, kawa espresso z tyłu, półsłodkie, dość gęste, intensywne, treściwe, z bardzo długimi, przyjemnymi posmakami. Goryczka średnia do wysokiej, kawowo palona, nisko wysycone, lekko alkoholowe na finiszu, ale w bardzo przyjemny, rumowy sposób.

Bardzo miłe rozczarowanie - piwo klasy światowej, mile świetlne przed naszymi porterami bałtyckimi z Żywca, Okocimia czy innymi szeroko dostępnymi w sklepach...
Tap at warszawski festiwal piwa. Aroma of roasty malt, cocoa and coffee, dried fruits. Taste is sweet and bitter, nice and complex.
Black with a medium light brown head. Aroma is licorice, coffee and roasted malt. Taste is dark chocolate, bread and licorice

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2016 Frisch vom Hahn im Hopfenreich. Tiefstschwarz ohne merkenswerten Schaum. In der Nase Bitterschokolade und schwarze Röstaromen. Kakao-, Kaffee- und Lakritzaromen. Wärmt gut durch.
Am 4.12.16 aus der Flasche getrunken (Batch 117). Wertung: 6/5/9/4/17!

Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with small to medium, light brown, semi-densed head. Average head retention and poor lacing. Deep roasted malts aroma (milk chocolate, coffee) along with some dark fruits (plums in chocolate, raisins), also medium caramel and brown sugar notes, some licorice. Minus for quite noticeable high ABV content. Taste is semi-sweet from the beginning of degustation, from the middle of degustation the bitterness becomes more intense up to medium level. Full body, thick and oily texture, average carbonation, finish is bitter, ashy with semi-dry character combined with some pharmacy-like sensations (not so pleasant), ABV warming is light to medium. In general this is interesting baltic porter with quite contrast in taste comparing the beginning with the end. Rate is not so high for two reasons - weird finish and poorly hidden booze.

BKL2016.
Black , brown head. 
Dry roast, coffee, choc, berries but elegant and not dried out. 
Nice long dark chocolate base infused with coffee, resin, nice balance, medium full
Great drinkable.

Tap at Zwanze Day 2016 in Elkader, IA. Another one of the days standouts. Very dark dense pour with a tan head. Licorice, roast, ash. Great depth and complexity. We were talking about it in comparison to the Duck Rabbit Baltic Porter, and that is high praise indeed.
Tap at Scheras for Zwanze day. Dark black pour. Aroma is a little booze, dark malts. Taste is booze up front but quickly moves to other things, some ashyness. Really well done, great porter.
Unclear black colored beer with a beige head. Taste is chocolade, coffee, sweet, nice bitternes and roasted malts.

On tap @ Braufest Berlin 2016 - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, coffee, caramel and alcohol finish. Taste: full body with massive roasted malt, coffee and sweet notes. Good attenuation, quiet drinkable, oily sensation. Aftertaste: coffee, roasted malt and alcohol. Quiet boozy.

Bottle shared! Thanks Raul. Pours a heavy, oily black with a small brown head. Big toasty malt nose with dark fruit and some light sourness present. Medium body and very drinkable. Lots of raisin and coffee with an underlying roastiness and tartness.
Zwart bier met donkerbruin schuim wat snel wegzakt. Smaak is krachtig, zoet en vol/warm met iets van chocolade, rum of cognac en vanille. Erg goed bier.

Black body with a creamy, brown, long-lived head that sticks to the glass. Malty, dry and strong aroma of dark roasted malt, bitter chocolate, cocoa, coffee, ash and liquorice. Pretty intense flavour of dark roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, sweet liquorice and brown sugar, and berries and alcohol in the back. Moderate sweet taste (its far sweeter than the aroma led me to expect) with a rather heavy bitter and long-lasting finish. Full body, creamy texture, rather soft carbonation. A lovely dessert! 
[33 cl bottle, batch 187, enjoyed 5 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]
Bottle drink Tallinn. Black slight head. Good roasty dark fruit aroma and taste good mollases nice sweetness. Nice mouthfeel. Good stuff.
Negro opaco y espuma beis. Aromas de tostado, café, chocolate, licor y fruto negro. Cuerpo denso y sabor de chocolate, fruto negro, y final de amarigor quemado y licoroso.
Wow! Completely balanced, packing chocolatey, roasted flavours. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation.

Bottle @ home. Aroma of roasted malt, dark caramel, light- boozy, chocolate and some mild coffee. Black with tan lasting head. Taste is moderate malt bitter and light sweet. Full body, thick feel, malt bitter finish.

Bijna zwart van kleur, de lichtbruine kraag is snel ingezakt. Smaakindrukken: koffie, caramel, mokka, peper, chocolade, vrij zoet met een licht bittere afdronk. Aroma is zoet, koffie, iets peperigs, amandelspijs. Flink wat body en nasmaak.

Bottle. Brown body with reddish tones, small beige head. Aroma of licorice, blueberry jam, toffee, leather notes and hints of whiskey. Taste of caramel, blueberry jam, licorice and herbs. Nice and round.

Black colored, small dark tan creamy ring. Aroma is of some caramel, brown sugar, dark chocolate and roasted malt, some burnt toast, light alcohol. Taste is medium to very sweet malt, dark chocolate, brown sugar, roasted malt, some dried fruits, burnt toast, some alcohol. Full bodied, soft carbonation, sticky. Excellent, even though it was a hot summer day, far away from the cold Estonian winters!
(on tap, Who Cares Festival, Bevog Brewery)
On tap at Hazel, DC. Dark brown body with thin head. Nose of lactose, malts and caramel. Taste is sweet, caramel, barley, quite different. Creamy texture in the finish.
Black with quick fading coffee-like head. Aroma and flavour are bittersweet treacle. Quite thick and oily.

Draft. Cherry, apple, chocolate malt, and hay aroma. Black with nice tan head. Very sweet cherry, apple, chocolate malt, and moderately bitter orange peel/grass flavor. Good body. Fruity and pleasant.

Gitzwart, bruine schuimkraag die snel inzakt, veel koolzuur zichtbaar. 
Aroma: Vanille, geroosterde mouten, karamel, donker fruit/bessen, pruim en rozijnen.
Scherp en een alcohol hint in de neus.
Smaak: Zoet donker gedroogd fruit, gevolgd door geroosterde donkere mouten, karamel, donkere chocolade en espresso sterke koffie. Daarna een flinke alcohol warmte (zeker bij opwarming) en een aardige hopbitter.
Veel smaken volgen elkaar op. Mooie lacing langs het glas....olieachtig. 
Body is vol, zacht en romig, zacht koolzuur, afdronk is zoet, plakkerig en vrij alcoholisch.......rustig wegnippen en genieten.
Je kunt dit trouwens ook gewoon een Russian Imperial Stout noemen hoor.

Il gusto al naso ritrova percezioni di liquirizia e orzo tostato. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma resiste poco, ha colore marrone castagno, la grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine e la carbonazione è media. Il colore del liquido è scuro impenetrabile. La carbonazione è media, quasi abbondante, frizzante e persistente. Il corpo è strutturato pesante. Lamaro è deciso. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è estremo per una birra che ha una sua personalità. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di birra impegnativa a causa dellelevato grado alcolico. Il finale è lungo, pulito, complesso e asciutto. Il retrogusto è intenso e persistente. Laroma in bocca riporta sentori di caramello, miele, cioccolato, caffè, fiori, etilico e alcol invadente.

On tap at Who Cares for Beer 2016 Beer Festival, Bevog Brewery, Bad Radkersburg, Austria. Shared with His Highness Kaiser und König Igor and Rasta Teacher Mark. Black, medium brown head. Leather, licorice, red fruits, roasty. Sweet, alcohol, roasty. Oily texture, full body. Good one.
Bottle. Pours oily black with small brown head. Aroma has licorice, some roastiness, some coffee and dark malts. Taste of bitter chocolate, some ash and roastiness too, some coffee. Very good one.

12oz bottle at Wirre, served at room temp, pours an oily, leggy, opaque black with some cloudy beige head. Nose has nougat, chocolate, booze, toast, dried fruits. Flavor is interesting, port, chocolate, licorice, raisin, some burnt caramel, chocolate covered espresso bean. Full bodied, oily, boozy finish.

A true gurmee Baltic Porter! Aromas of dark chocolate, eastern Estonian forests, slight smoke and salt and sweet coffee. Hints of dark fruits. No abv fumes. Taste of chocolate truffles with rum, plums, bitter chocolate, delicate abv-burn. Silky mouthfeel. Admirably dry finish.

Shared BOTTLE 33 CL. Pitch oily black, small dark beige head. Typical baltic porter aroma - aldehide-ish fruit, big dark malts but not roasty, some grainy oiliness. Clean dark caramel, super light roast and nice bitterness. Just a touch of ashes. Alcohol well hidden but theres still a nice warmth. Very good.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 330ml bottle. This is beautiful. Perfect opaque black pour. Nose all espresso. Taste is big black bitterness with strong bitter coffee, liquorice, figs and port. This is boozy and strong and packs a real punch. Could be a little thicker palate wise, but the flavour cannot be faulted. Superb.

My Bottom Line:
This chocolate truffle of a Baltic Porter expands onto toasty lengths and bitter roastiness before the deepest dark chocolate establishes a languorous kiss on the palate.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the pitch black.
-The chocolate malt presence is simply beautiful. Think 90% cocoa and real truffle material.
-Hop resins contribute to the finish as well.
-A smidgen of fruitiness is found.
-This is not a Baltic Porter in the heavy and sugary range. It is an ode to dark malts.
-Mouthfeel is smooth and rich.

Bottle.

Chocolate pralines, sweet coffee, dark, sweet toasted malts. Black, medium, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet. More intense chocolate, intense caramel and generic molasses, soft carbonation, cacao adds some dryness, slightly bitter finish. Beautiful Baltic Porter, fantastic chocolate and coffee throughout. Bottle from BeersnMore, Zurich.

Black color with brown head. Aroma has roasted malts, even a bit of smoke, umami, dark chocolate and a hint of dark fruits. Taste starts with dark chocolate, rich malts, slightly roast acidity, continues with some booze soaked fruits and finishes with roasted coffee bitterness. Rich body with smooth carbonation. Feels more like a classic russian imperial stout but thats a plus for me.

Kirkas hyvin tummanruskea olut ei vaahtoa juurikaan. Vain hyvin pieni beige vaahtoreunus kiertää lasia. Tuoksu on salmiakkinen ja lakritsinen sekä kahvisen paahteinen. Maultaan olut on melko makea, paahteinen ja kevyen kahvinen. Melko paksu ja täyteläinen suutuntuma. Laatutuote etelänaapurista.

Noire dense, collet fin mais persistant.
Aromes intenses sur le café, liqueur.
Dense, ronde et amère qui tient longuement sur des saveurs toujours tres café.

Bottle from Voldby. Pours pitch black with a dark brown head. Aroma and taste is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, liquorice, caramel, dark fruits. Full body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Nice roasted finish. Excellent.

Deze Baltische porter heeft een krachtig aroma van kandij en mokka. Deze komen duidelijk terug in de smaak, evenals chocolade, gebrande koffie en vanille. Er zit zelfs een licht zuurtje in. Mooie balans tussen bitter (droog) en zoet. Viskeus bier, zwart en heel weinig schuim, dat snel wegtrekt.

Lukt: Kaffe, lakris, sjokolade og alkohol.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tykt dekkende brunt skum som forsvinner raskt. Mye karbonering ved åpening.
Smak: Nydelig, kaffe og lakris, noe alkohol i avslutningen.

Kommentar: Flaske med trøkk i, mistet i gulvet, det var nok til at korken ikke greide holde trykket. Måtte til med nød drikking. Gikk heldigvis bra, ikke mye til spille og en generelt god øl bortsett fra alcoholen.
Drukket Som Alias@Põhjala Öö Imperial Baltic Porter.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2016 Bottle. Pours pitch black with frothy tanned head. Aroma is cacao beans, roasted malts, soy sauce. Taste is heavy, sweet, bitter, with notes of dark chocolate, licorice, esters with a burnt finish.
Alcohol (rum), coffee and chocolate, pitch black with a huge and rocky brown head, medium/full body, oily, law/medium carbonation, roasted and coffee...a beautiful dream under the two moon.
A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, alcohol, and soy sauce. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt

From the bottle at 10.5 percent. Dark brown and opaque with a khaki foam. Smoke and leather aromas. Very good mouthfeel. Creamy. Chocolate, smoke, and espresso flavors. Smooth bitterness. This brewery is impressive.

On tap at BD57, april 9th 2016. Black body with small brown head. Aroma of strong roast, chocolate, leather. Taste is sweet, chocolate and toffee, mild bitterness, creamy chocolate and vanilla finish. Very nice balanced and enjoyable.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of chocolate, light coffee, roasted malt, German sausage. Taste is sweet, chocolate and roasted malt, slightly bitter licorice finish. Rich, sticky body with soft carbonation.
Many thanks for this beer to Erzengel. Pours very dark brown color, light brown head. Taste has toast, strong caramel and alcohol.

Many thanks to rosenbergh for this bottle!  Malty nose, thick and sweetish. The beer is very intense roasted with a moderate bitterness. Lots of malty sweetness, very sweetish-sticky, Nice round bitterness in the aftertaste. Long malty sweetish sticky aftertaste with a nice intense bitterness. Round and fresh, quite easy to drink for that thick high ABV. Very round and sweetish-tasty brew.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, tar and hints of chocolate. Flavour is roasted, medium to heavy sweet, light bitter, coffee, cocoa beans, tar and dark chocolate. Really tasty.

A nice heavy porter with chocolate, roasted, coffee aromas contrasted with some sweet fruity (blueberry?) tones. This bit of sweetness makes it a bit easier to drink than an average porter and makes it stand out. Quite nice, definitally worth a try.

On tap at the Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016, Amsterdam - day#2 (03-Jul-2016). Brown/black in colour with a small beige coloured head. Aroma of dark fruit, malt, cocoa beans and coffee. Medium/full body and soft carbonation. Taste of dark fruit, roasted malt and milk chocolate. Smooth, light bitterness, but a little thin on the palate.

Dark sweet roasted malty aroma and taste with chocolate, coffee, liquorice, molasses, caramel, some burnt malty notes, vanilla caress into the close. Gorgeous.

DWF; Bottle 0,33L., from Vinmonopolet. Pours moderate to large, black with a frothy creamy, lasting and lacing tan head. Nose is moderate to heavy, roasted malt, coffee, moderate chocolate and liqorice. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter with a lasting roasted, sweet, salt liquorice , warming, light coffee finish. Body is medium to full, texture is thick, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2016 Completely black, with a fine sheet of foam around the edges of the glass. Complex and intense, lots of dark malts, treacle and caramel, extremely roasty. Flavour is similar, extremely roasty, intense, treacle, caramel, sweet, foresty (like being in a pine forest, but not resiny). Very nice, maybe a bit one-sided.
Bottle from rimi, tallinn. Black color, brown head. Aroma has rich roastiness, coffee. Full body, lots of coffee, chocolate. Nearly perfect porter.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and moderate hopppy aroma. Strong coffee notes, Heavy bitter stroing coffee flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Too much cold coffee to be great.

Bottle, les Berthom, Strasbourg. Black, medium beige head. Aroma marzipan, cocoa, hints of anise. Full body, very soft carbonation. Taste sweet, largely mimics aroma, marzipan the dominant feeling. Towards the end turns hoppy and leads into ling bitter finish. Wonderful experience.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une belle robe noir café. Les arômes sont fins sur des notes soja grillé, café froid corsé et amer. Une bouche douce à la finale très zan. Une belle gourmandise. En accompagnement dune carbonade ou dune dégustation chocolat noir dorigine.

Bottle from Hamburg at home. Pours an opaque black with a diminishing beige head. Sweet with a light bitterness. Aromas of toasted malts with notes of toffee and toast. Tiny hints of black pepper and alcohol. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Long bitter finish.
Smell of coffee, tar. Black colour, dark brown head. Aroma of coffee, tar, salmiakki, also some alcohol. Very bitter. Light but sharp carbon. Very heavy body, viscous texture. Balanced and awesome.

Bottle 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, sweet, chocolate, coffee, licorice.

Aroma: roaste dark malts, chocolate, cocoa.
Appearance: deep black color and brown head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, warming alcohol, roasted dark malts, bitter chocolate, coffee, smooth, semi-dry.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Really good baltic porter, smooth and nicely roasted.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, mocha, molasses, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, chocolate, mocha and molasses; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Jesus Christ Põhjala is really good at brewing dark beers. Could have been thicker, but is still very smooth and soothing. Great flavour with loads of chocolate, coffee and anything in between.

Dark brown, almost black colour. Hints of chocolate, cocoa, cream, coffee. Cocoa at first. Hints of chocolate. Bitter chocolate in the middle. Roasted malts. Cocoa in the end. Bitterness and chocolate also in the aftertaste. Heavy bodied, medium carbonated, really enjoyable beer in a cold day.

Tap at Fairbar, Aarhus. Poured black with a tan colour head. Aroma of black coffee, chocolate, and malt. Medium sweetness, medium+ roasted bitterness. Full bodied, thick texture, Soft carbonation. Good Baltic Porter.
Tap @ Fairbar. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, hard roasted malt and heavy licorice. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. Oily. 070616
Bottle.Pitch black colour with large beige head.Aroma is salty with flavor of licorice and roasted malt,also flavor of soya sauce and caramel good full body and roasted finish.

33cl. Botlle. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, alcohol, booze. 
Taste caramel chocolate sweets, some roasted coffee bitters. 
Mouthfeel thick, creamy. 
Great beer

Bottled, 330ml at Les Berthom, Nancy, France. Black with tan head. This is a big, thick, darkly roasted malt porter. Tarry with liquorice and bitter chocolate notes. Palate gripping but still quite smooth. Charry coffee notes in the close. Excellent.
Van t vat. Zwart bier met beige/bruine schuimkraag. Geur: kalisse, drop. Smaak: zoetig, kalisse, drop, alcoholisch, koffie. Volmondig. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoetig.

330 ml bottle at home. Dark brown almost black with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, licorice, cocoa, dark dried fruits, some smoked notes, light alcohol. Sweet and biter taste like aroma and even better. Full silky oily body with soft carbonation.

10-MAY-2016, bottle @home, from Kihoskh.
Black with a lasting, lacing, Brown head.
Sooo smooth. Roast, chocolate, cacao. Full body, soft carbonation, fantastic.

Draught at Fermentoren.
Pitch black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel and chocolate.
Roasted flavor of caramel and chocolate with notes of licorice.
Roasted finish.

Tap 0.3 l, ZUP, Wrocław, Poland.
Czarne piwo z ciemnobeżową, obfitą, gęstą, sztywną i puszystą pianą oraz słodkawym, lekko owocowym i kawowym aromatem. W smaku gęste, słodowe, owocowe, kawowe z waniliowymi nutami oraz z łagodnie wytrawnym, lekko palonym, rozgrzewającym i likierowym finiszem.

Flavor: strong malt aroma of dark malts, which takes on coffee, dark chocolate, oat, supported with hop flavors, which takes on stone plums, like plums, prunes etc. Finish is sticky dry, body is full, texture is silky smooth, carbonation is low. 
Baltic porter? I would say, it was brewed with top fermented yeasts.

Appearance: Pitch black with a big brown creamy head. mostly lasting, excellent lacing. 
Aroma: coffee, roasted malt, hint of ginger,
Taste: Sweetish, milk chocolate, dates, roasted malts, hints of ginger and honey.. Moderate roasted and chocolate bitter. light alcohol warmth. Full body, oily and creamy texture, Allmost lat carbonation. 


A bit tii sweet,, but still a more then good beer.

Bottle, pours black and tan. Dark chocolate, cafe latte, mocha, roast, hint of ginger, spicy. Sweet and bitter, silky texture, full body, soft carbonation, lingering chocolate and spicy finish with some hot flashes. Very nice.
Deep black with tan head. Heavy coffee and roasted cocoa aroma. Milk sweetness and dark caranel chocolate. Heavy body and warm alcohol finish.

33cl bottle at home from Kaapse Brouwers, Rotterdam. Body is pitch black, head is big, brown, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is coffee, roasted malt, flavor is honey, dark chocolate, mild coffee, roasted malt, milk chocolate, dates. Medium to heavy sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty medium bittersweet, lots of chocolate, but not dark, light alcohol warmth. Full body, oily and creamy texture, nearly flat carbonation. A bit too sweet which makes it a bit heavy, but still tasty and great dessert beer.
Ziet er prachtig uit, zwart met mooie bruine kraag. Lekkere volle porter. Gebrande mout, koffie, chocolade en iets alcoholisch (lijkt op jenever). Prima body en carbo.

0,33 l bottle 
coffee, roasty, chocolate, herbs, earthy, black, hazy, frothy, brown foam, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Bottle. Chocolate, coffee, molasses and roasted malts. Heavy sweetness and mild bitterness. Full palate, albeit light. Quite bitter and dry finish.

Almost black, opaque, without head.

Aroma: sweet coffee, sweet chocolate liqueur.
Taste: sweet with prominent bitterness.
Flavour: sweet robusta with milk, burner black bread, liquorice, hops, alcohol.

Very pleasant and warming.

Black beer with a tan and creamy head with good retention. Aroma has notes of roasted malts, black ripe fruits, light coffee and licorice and caramelish sweet notes. Flavor is toasty, licorice, ripe fruit, slightly sweet. Toasty final with a light presence of alcohol in spite of its high % of ABV, light sweetness. Creamy and smoothy mouthfeel.

bottle at home, dark black colour with a tanned head. nose of your basic stout. roasted notes, dark malts, caramel, some dark coffee mixed with some fruited dark fruits. plums, and some licorice. pretty basic stour or porter. medium bodied. but nothing special
Smells like roasted malts. Thick and heavy pitch black beer with small deep brown foam. Rich complex and powerful flavor. Too strong for a full bottle so split with a friend. Really excellent brew.

[9/27/15] Draught sample at Borefts After Festival 2015 in Rotterdam. Black with a brown head. Great aroma of chocolate, fudge, liqueur, a bit of dark fruits notes. Sweet flavor with chocolate, roast, and a bitterish finish. Full-bodied.

Fles gekocht @De Molen Beershop. Mooi zwart bier. Geuren van gebrande mout, gedroogd fruit en drop. Ook in de smaak komt dit terug, met vooral de smaak van salmiak in de nasmaak. Een rijke volle smaak, eerst wat zoetig, daarna licht bitter. Mooie baltic porter!

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 On tap @ Hoppiness Beer Stop. Pours pitch black with thin creamy light brown head and nice lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and grassy hops. Taste starts with sweet and rich roasted malt, follows by vanilla, nuts, chocolate and licorice, mouthfeel is warming alcoholic, while finish is moderate bitter. Full body, thick texture and soft carbonation in palate. This one quickly brings you night in front of your eyes...

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Re-rate on October 2nd 2016 of 33 cl bottle from Kihoskh; Batch #223; BBD: April 14th 2017) Poured at fridge temperature into a signature Põhjala stemmed tulip glass reveals a pitch black body with three fingers of deep toffee head that fades to one finger after a minute and otherwise shows good retention and lace. Decent regeneration. Aroma is heavy on the roast with notes of rye bread and an undercurrent of booze wrapped in malt that has medicinal connotations. Oily texture, medium body, soft carbonation and a lingering, warming finish. Flavour is dominated by roast bitterness and boozy astringency. Letting it warm a bit only promotes the boozy, roasted malt qualities. Im afraid my initial impression of this beer still holds water to me and Im somewhat puzzled this is the 11th best Baltic Porter in the world. 
Original rating from October 1st 2015: Ar: 6; Ap: 3; Ta: 6; Pa: 3; O: 12
(33 cl bottle from Tallin supermarket; Batch #112; BBD: 07/09/16) Poured at fridge temperature into a footed tulip reveals a pitch black body with one finger deep toffee head that fades somewhat leaving film and beautiful lace. Aroma has some booze but also some roasted malt with chalky notes. Oily texture, soft carbonation, full body and slightly sweet and somewhat astringent finish. Flavour is boozy and a little sweet.
Bottled at SBWF.  Black, no head. Rich aroma of chocolate and espresso. Sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel, low carbonation. Rich and dense with espresso and chocolate. Warming bitter finish.
Bottle at SBWF2015. Opaque black color, steady beige head. Aroma is toasted, milky and a bit chocolaty. Medium-bodied. Sweetish, chocolaty, lots of sweet licorice! Velvety and pleasant.
The best imperial baltic porter Ive drunk ever! Very thick and full body, so creamy and coffee.

Keg at Kaapse, After Borefts Beer Festival, Rotterdam, Netherlands, Saturday 26th September 2015   Pours black, shark eye black, really very dark. Dark and sticky, really sticky, quite bitter and roasty with a warmth though the abv is quite well hidden. Some coffee and chocolate, nice., A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, vanille, crème, koffie. Mooie volle geur. Smaakt vol drop,vanille crème.
Pikkie zwart met een mooie bruine kraag. Ruikt geroosterd, koffie, gebrand. . Smaakt snoepjes, koffie, gebrand en geroosterd.

Bottle at home. Black pour, thin tan head. Very rich aroma of roasted malts, coffee, bread, chocolate, caramel, nuts and some dark fruits. Flavor is quite sweet and somewhat bitter, thick bodied, nicely carbonated and with an amazing balance. Incredibly well made brew, fantastic. Seriously one of the best stouts Ive ever had.
Dark brown, almost black with small brown head. Sweet, bit roasted aroma. Medium bitter roasted taste, some sourness and sweetness. Vanilla and coffee notes.
Tap at Brewdog Helsinki, Helsinki. Colour is black with brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Very roasty but too sweet.

Bottle from pub at Tallink Silja Line. Small creamy beige head. Black body. Smells of roasted malt, oat, chocolate, vanilla, coffee. Tastes a lot of vanilla, chocolate, nuts, coffee, syrup. Very sweet but also salt with a bitter finish.
Bottled. Pours pitch black with a big brown head. Smells salty, coffee, licorice, dark chocolate. Tastes salty, rich dark chocolate, raisins, a bit sweet with a chocolate mild bitter finish.

Keg at Brewdog Helsinki, Fin. Pours almost black with brown head, oily appearance. Nose is huge roast, sweetness and warmth of alcohol, dark chocolate, a hint of liquorice. Taste is rather sweet, liquorice, roasted malts, chocolate. Quite sweet but I do like it, especially the liquorice notes.

..33l bottle @Hannikus Cave.
Pours black with nice tan head. Aroma is coffee, coco beans, milk chocolate, burned malts, some liquorice. Flavor is mostly same. Hint of alcohol, dark fruits and salty liguorice. In the end nice hop kick. Great!

Thanks for picking up this beer! 330 ml. bottle. I have been quite curious about this modern boutique craft brewer (& apparently importer) from Estonia. A beer location that is completely unknown to me still. This one calls itself an Imperial Baltic Porter which is new to me. The ABV is slightly higher than the average Baltic Porter but not by that much, the taste is very big. It doesnt specify whether it is top or bottom fermented but it does come across as being top fermented to me. Pours very, very dark brown, close to black with a thick, hugely creamy coffee- head that does sadly collapse a bit too quickly. Overall still a gorgeous looking beer. Nose is heavy on roast, very roasted, close to burned coffee with a good amount of charcoal, there is some caffeine & mocha sweetness underneath, vaguely reminiscent of mocha ice-cream but the bitterness & heavy roast are the two dominating characteristics. The charcoal note is quite noticeable & dominant. Taste is heavy on bitterness, heavy roast, bitter roast, charcoal, burned coffee, charred malts, light berries, heavy roast, grainy, touch ashes, bitter liquorice, 95+ % cacao black chocolate, some light mocha ice-cream in the back but the roast & bitterness coming from the heavy roasted character reign supremely here. Body is a touch lighter than you would expect, rather grainy, a bit ashy. A bit too heavy on the roast for me  it does lend the beer a somewhat more unique quality  this one was still quite enjoyable. The roast did bring down the drinkability a bit for me. The bottle does state that this beer was intended as a slow sipper.
Bottle from VamboladeTolly, many thanks. Almost black color with small beige head. Dark malt, licorice, molasses, vanilla, caramel in aroma. Taste, sweet malt, caramel, coffee, alcohol. Tasty.

Ruskea väri, kahvicremen ruskea vaahto, kohtalainen viipyvyys. Miedon makeahko suklainen tuoksu. Kylmänä metallinen sivumaku, tylppä. Lämmettyään avautuu huomattavasti, tuoksussa luumua ja alkoholia, makeahko alkoholin polte, muistuttaa jopa Dark Horizoneja?

Look; light brown good head and black body. Aroma; dark malts, dark fruits, blackcurrant, cocoa. Taste; dark roasted malts, coffee, black chocolate, blackcurrant - leading to a soft and lingering juicy finish with cocoa notes. Good body, soft to normal carbonation. Overall good porter. How: Bottle.
Where: Tritonia Ölverkstad Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Chocolate, some liquorice, some more chocolate, a bit of coffee.
Body: Medium body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, coffee, liquorice, sweet malt, some alcohol, berries.

0,33l fles bij hopner in tallinn. Zwart als de nacht met een mooie bruine kraag.Geur blauwe bessen, cacao en koffiebonen. Smaak begint wat alcoholisch, daarna wederom blauwe bes, in de afdronk komt de koffie en cacao weer om de hoek. Jammer dat de alcohol iets te veel op de voorgrond treed, had anders echt een topper kunnen zijn.
Bottle. Deep brown color with a huge beige head. Aroma of licorice, peat and notes of almond. Very sweet taste with a long bitter finish.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle at home, black beer, small/medium head, aroma is roast, chocolate, liquorice, taste is the same, dark fruit, very nice.
Appearance is typical porter. Charcoal, wine and vanilla. Roasted malts with sweetness and hops. An abrupt fizzy palate. All in all a nice Baltic porter.
Aroma: roasty, alcohol, bread, toast. Appearance: black, clear, rocky head, brown foam. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness. Palate: full body, creamy, flat, bitter finish, astringent.

Draught @ Brewdog Bar, Helsinki. Pours a black colour with a small head. Aroma of roastiness, bread, licorice and grass. Flavour of roastiness, licorice, salt, chocolate, bread and earth. Full bodied. Oily. Very rich. Enjoyable.
Deep dark brown,beige ring. Aroma of sweet vinous chocolate. Full body, flavour as the aroma, light liquorice. Very well balanced.

33cl bottle from ABCBeers courtesy of me shared with SIC1314.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Some chocolate. Very nice.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Black body. Brown head. This one cut her nails!
A good mix between roast, liquorice, leaves and some raisin. Also some hints of malt roast, carbo gass, cream, vanilla, smoke and toffee.
Very clean but also very rich roast and liquorice tones. Supported by raisin, dark liquor tint, bitter, herbal and malt roast, some chocolate/marzipan, something light creamy and a hint of soy.
Aftertaste is roast, liquorice, rasisin, bitter and some toffee tones.
Low carbo, foam creamy mouthfeel, close to full bodied.
Very nice stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Black body, light brown head. Aroma has roasted malts, some berries and some wine. Very acidic and roasted and ash taste. Robust one.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Joes. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized light to medium brown colored head. Aroma is malts, roasted malts, liquorice. Taste malts, roasted malts, liquorice, pretty sweet, a sweetish dark fruit something. Aroma is better than the flavor imo. Medium body and soft carbonation.

Bottle @ joes. Pitch black colour with a small light brown head. Smells roasty, quite sweet, weird confiture. Tastes roasty, very sweet, confiture, some blackberry, cardboard. Medium to full body, nice carbo.

Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, hint of alcohol. Flavour is quite sweet with a moderate coffee roasty hoppy bitter finish. A rich and tasty Porter, pleasant roast and chocolate flavours, but I found the sweetness a bit much.

Butelka; barwa czarna. Piana brązowa, drobna, opada do obrączki. Aromat czekoladowy, karmelowy, suszonych owoców, śliwek, nalewki śliwkowej. Smak karmelowy, czekoladowy, śliwkowy, nalewki. Alkohol fajnie wkomponowany. Goryczka średnia.
Pitch black, medium head. Aroma: a lot of coffee, roastiness, raisins, sugar. Taste: coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruit. Great stuff.

0.33L bottle, batch 039. Cocoa, toffee, malt aroma. Beautyful black color with medium size brown foam on top. Fat and mute. Very soft and same time rough as well. Bitter cocoa, caramel bread, overcooked sugar, dark bitter chocolate, vanilla. Some bitter note at the finish. Chocolate pudding mouthfeel . Spiced and smoked feeling. Very nice.
Whats Brewing 2014. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, hop, molasses, coffee, cocoa. Flavour is roasted malt, vanilla, mocha, coffee, cocoa, molasses, sugar. Very nice beer.

Black, medium brown head. Cocoa, roastiness, some dark caramel on the nose, with some smokey notes. Full body, sweet, roasty chocolate with some light alcohol notes - but only a wee bit. Finishes bittersweet and a bit warming. Lovely.
Drank from a bottle. Very good, very dark. There is some chocolate together with great malts.
pours black with beige head. Aroma: roasted malts, chocolate, alcohol, Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, chocolate. Palate: full body, creamy,
Bottle 0,33l. Pours black color with tan head. Aroma sweet, black bread, smoke, coffee, chocolate. Taste medium sweet, lightly bitter, chocolate, coffee. full body, oily feel, long finish.

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Shared with friends.
Dark, not transparent. Rich usual for porter aroma, complex & intense taste: smoked, roasted, coffee, chocolate, nuts. Very good.
Bottle from drink Shop, Tallinn. Dark black with xl non lasting head (10 C). Dark berries, burned, alcohol. Quite sweet for porter. Lasting bitterness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

29th March 2015Opaque black - brown beer, good pale tan head. Palate is airy and a little soft, mild fine carbonation. Soft dark mals, a light oaty sweetnesss. Semi sweet chocolate and coffee. Mild tangy fruits underneath. Smooth finish. Very well behaved for its abv and this quite drinkable.

Nice roasted aroma, hints of alcohol, some sweetness and bit of cocoa.
Beautifully black, with nice brown head, but vanished within seconds. Very tasty, thats exactly what I expect from baltic porter. Sweet, full bodied, bit oily average carbonation, long-lasting bitter finnish. Id say its closer to baltic porter than to imperial stout/porter. Good one, definitely worth trying.

Black colour and beige head. Aroma is really sweet with syrup, caramel and berries. Taste has red berries, caramel, syrup and hints of alcohol coming in the after taste. Really sweet. Full body and low carbonation. Really sweet imperial porter, but I like sweet things so this was pretty good.
Draught, small @ Bryggeri Helsinki. Sweet roasted aroma. Think and sweet porter. Mämmi. Forest. Alright.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2015 On tap at BrewDog Helsinki. Pours nearly black with a little but lasting brown head. The aroma features salted licorice, coffee and plenty of dark, plummy fruitiness. Taste is light sweet with a fairly low level of roastiness for this style; sweetish malty and dark fruity notes are coupled with drier coffee-themed notes in the finish. Fairly prominent malt character, not much hoppy nuances. No alcohol features despite strength. The palate is full bodied with a creamy texture and a flat carbonation. A good rich Baltic porter with a touch of plum.

Draught @ Bryggeri Helsinki 

Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, loads of licorice, dark chocolate, coffee and hints of leather . Taste is smooth, roasty and heavy with hints of sweet syrup, licorice, toffee, wood and dark chocolate. Finish is roasty, sweetish and heavy with hints of syrup, toffee and wood. A bit unbalanced.

Draught. Pours black in color, small tan head. Roasted malts, sweet dark syrup and vinous notes in aroma. Bit of marzipan sweetness, some bitter dark chocolate and vinous notes in taste. Not enough with roasted notes here though here, felt a bit raw and unfinished too.
A small taste @ Bryggeri Helsinki. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with alcohol and chocolate. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, alcohol, chocolate and some hops. Nice.

33 cl bottle @ Bier-Bier. Batch #33: BBE 25.11.2015. Aroma has cocoa abd strong salty licorice tones. Flavour has pleasant mocha tones, salty licorice, herbs and hints of dark chocolate. Better than the old version, I like the coffee tones here. They were not present there.
